sourceMeaningMnemonic: In this <radical>construction</radical> project, they will be using <radical>thread</radical> to hold everything together. The color of the thread is a <kanji>deep red</kanji>, and it gives everything a <kanji>crimson</kanji> look.
meaningInfo: Because thread isn't that strong, you have to use A LOT (to hold things like beams in place). So, the deep red / crimson thread actually stands out a lot in this construction project.
readingMnemonic: You're done, and the whole building is a <kanji>deep red</kanji> <kanji>crimson</kanji> color (it takes a lot of thread to hold a whole building in place). It's time to show the client, Emperor <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja>, the finished product.
readingInfo:
<ja>こういち</ja> walks up with a big smile on his face. "I love the color crimson!" he exclaims. "It's the same deep red color as my enemies."

Hint: When you see <ja>工</ja> in a kanji it will often take the <ja>こう</ja> reading.
